column4: flash plugin got removed when i upgraded to lucid. how should i reinstall it so it works for firefox and chrome?
either download it manually and install it or just install flashplugin-nonfree
when i did that it said flashplugin-nonfree is already at its newest version
try re-installing it then
how do i reinstall it
sudo aptitude reinstall flashplugin-nonfree
why aptitude instead of apt?
my preference, I suppose.  aptitude is a package manager like synaptic.
i still dont have flash in my browsers even after reinstalling that :(
you're re-starting the browser, yes?
can you make sure libflashplugin.so exists in /usr/lib/mozilla/plugins ?
it's not in there
can you runs a: find /usr/lib/ -name libflashplayer.so
mine showed up in /usr/lib/flashplugin-installer/
not in there either\
nothing? really?  what browser are you using specifically?
the ff that comes w lucid
well, you can download the flashplugin from adobe directly, and copy it (with root privs) to /usr/lib/mozilla/plugins/
i tried to install the flash plugin form adobe and gdebi tried to install install_flash_player_10_linux.deb but said invalid architecture i386 (i have an amd 64)
that would have really helped to know right off
sorry :p
get the beta x64 flash
